question: Do we have the damn interview or don't we?
I can't blow off the Three-Asian War for "close".
answer: All respect, Bob, nobody cares about dead Orientals... they care about Ken Castle -

question: I'll freak a burger.
Slayers.
Why isn't it murder?
answer: Gina, when was the last time you saw someone volunteer to be murdered? I'm sure you know that every last one of our Slayers is a bona fide death row inmate - ...each one offered a chance to participate as an alternative to their sentence. Stay alive for thirty sessions and get set free... that's not a bad God damned deal.

question: I see - and has any one of these men or women ever actually survived long enough to be set free?
answer: I'd remind your audience that Slayers was put together with the full cooperation and approval of the United States federal government... that the revenue it produces is responsible for funding our entire prison system - keeping the bad guys behind bars... and that the prop was voted for by a cock solid 68% of the American public.

question: ... in an election tainted by suspected digital fraud... let's talk about the so-called generi-cons.
answer: There's a lot of men and women in prison that could never cut it as slayers... shouldn't they have the same opportunity to roll the dice for a ticket out? Besides - they only need to survive one session.

question: Right... Mr. Castle - how the hell does it work?
Geek, geek, geek - come on, Castle, you promised us a demonstration.
answer: Did I? You know I seem to recall that - let's just see...

question: Oh... my god. So cute.
answer: You like her? Her name is Gina. She's a good little bitch.

question: Isn't it true that each human that undergoes the procedure will have a distinct IP address -- like a notebook computer or mobile device?
answer: Similar, yep. But control is strictly localized to the parameters of our gaming environments.

question: That's a relief.
answer: To some, maybe... to some... don't you suspect a good many folks wouldn't mind an itty bit of control?

question: I don't... um...
answer: Someone else making all the decisions for you... no responsibilities, no tough choices... think about it.

question: We will, Mr. Castle. We will.
I killed my best friend.
answer: You want to get back to them.

question: Who's talking?
What?
answer: Sign it... please, Tillman. My son David is your biggest fan. He prays for you.

question: Why would anyone want my name?
answer: You don't even know what's going on out there, do you? Damn...

question: Hey Kable. Who aims?
Who aims... the slayer? Or the player?
answer: Not much to aiming... it's just hand/eye coordination. I'm the hand... someone, somewhere else is the eye.

question: That's tripped.
answer: Sometimes... they take over - you know, completely. They move you. Like a robot. But it doesn't work so good... that part's just for show. You can't really fight that way.

question: Why?
Yeah, the ping... they talk about that. The time it takes the slayer to respond to the command... it's like, five millisecond ping, eight millisecond ping...
answer: Whatever you call it. A slice of a second is the difference between living and dying out there. When the trigger pulls -

question: Whatever you call it. A slice of a second is the difference between living and dying out there. When the trigger pulls -
Not interested.
Your head ain't on straight.
answer: I'm going to delete you too. On Sunday.

question: Yeah, probably.
answer: That's why they put me here.

question: - the fuck did you say?
answer: On the outside... oh, I'm sorry - I meant your pretty girls... You want to get back to them but I'm going to visit them first...

question: Tillman is a perfect soldier, a tactical killing computer - you dropped him in with common murderers. What did you expect?
answer: His instincts give him an edge.

question: And in the hands of a talented player...
answer: Of course we can never let him out. Not after what we did to him.

question: Who?
How come I can hear you?
Gamers can't talk to cons.
No. Pay attention to the game.
Wait a minute... are you twelve?
Bullshit. This is unbelievable. How am I not dead yet?
Gibs.
Like, giblets. Kibbles and bits. Chunks. Pieces.
Death row psychos, so what? They had it coming.
answer: Guess that goes for me too.

question: Yeah, but you're different.
Dude, I don't know. Cause you're MY psycho. Damn, new area.
Think about it, Kable
Well, yeah - I get that for you it's different.
There's nothing there.
answer: Kid, trust me - I was going house to house in Tehran while you were still sucking mommy's nipple.

question: Kid's gonna get me killed.
Listen to me. I don't know who's behind it, or why, but I was supposed to die today. They're gunning for us. I can beat them, but not with you controlling me.
Turn me loose, kid. You want to win, turn me loose.
So... Miss Roth.
Spouse incarcerated, life without possibility of parole. You use your maiden name.
answer: My husband - he... it's not entirely true, regarding his sentence. In fact, he's due to be released soon...

question: Your husband was charged and convicted of first degree murder, Miss Roth. I can hardly consider his release, if it was to occur, to be a positive.
Acting, is that what they call it?

Miss Roth. Your child has been... exceedingly well placed. The new family is very wealthy. She'll never want for anything. I understand you love your little girl, but... do you really think she'd be better off with people like you?
answer: Yes, I do. I'm her mother.

question: You like the software?
The walkie talkie, playa.
answer: No shit... you're the guy from TV. The HUMANZ.

question: That's right, baby. You think about what the brotha said?
answer: To what, um, brotha do you refer... brotha?

question: Kable wants the freedom to ass- kick. Do shit his way. You gonna give it to him?
We see and hear everything that goes on inside the so-called game.
answer: Alright, then. Kable said we got lucky - that they were gunning for us - what was that all about?

question: Kable got a past... he knows things. Things he don't even know he know.
Things Castle's afraid of. As long as your boy stay on the inside Castle know he can keep him quiet - but if ever got out... Uh uh. Castle will never let that happen.
answer: One battle left, I think I can handle my bidness.

question: You're not hearing me - this is not something you can control. They gonna kill his ass, Simon. In the eyes of the world. And then what? You just another poor little rich honky. No Kable, no pussy, no shit.
answer: This is, come on... too heavy... I don't know what the hell you're talking about... I just play games, man. Games.

question: Mm hm. That's right, it's a game. You want to win it, don't you?
Then you need to cutcho strings, puppet-massa.
A mod, that's all. Like that guidance system you hacked on three weeks ago lets you track motherfuckers around corners and shit.
The game got to mutate, after all. It got to evolve, you feel me?
answer: I do. I do feel you.

question: Tillman.
We know you talked to him... your Player.
answer: You're not a guard... who are you?

question: A friend.
Listen to me
I know something else
No. Listen to me, Tillman - the game is unwinnable - they will not let you live. If you're want to get out and see the people in the picture you'll have to find another way.
answer: I need you to get me something.

question: What, Kable... what can I get you?
I can see turning you loose was a great idea.
YOU happened, jackass. You wanted control, you got it.
Yeah, that's right. So please don't fuck up... What's the matter with you Kable? Kill something! Fuck it.
Dammit! Kable. Dude. What are you doing?
answer: Yeah? Anything else ya fuckin cheerleader?

question: She's not home.
You asked me that once before.
You a fool.
answer: Stop playing that freaky shit off the rail.

question: It's a game of deception.
answer: Whatever, that's cuz you got no power...

question: Guess you remember that day.
Sure. On the outside. Now look at these.
answer: Yeah, um... I need something too.

question: Do you now? And what might that be?
answer: Could you dudes do a sandwich like

question: Pistachio. They make that?
Tillman.

Come on. Ken Castle made his first billion designing virtual reality simulators for the US military. Six years ago he brought them something new - a breakthrough so profound, he said, that history would be divided up between everything before and everything that came after.
The second was you.
answer: The idea was to replace your brain, bit by bit, cell by cell, gradual... the new tissue would never break down, never deteriorate. A new era in human longevity is what they told us. We were doing the world a favor.

question: Nine weeks later Scotch was dead and you were serving life in maximum. Castle's project was shut down... but the shit wasn't a total loss
answer: Thank you for the history lesson.

question: Dig me, Tillman. Whatever happened in that project is something Castle wanna be buried. We need that shit, baby
answer: I don't know what to tell you.

question: Tillman. Never thought I'd be so glad to see your ugly grille.

Scotch. I'll tell you what man They got me hooked up to computers five hours a day... nurses feeding me vitamins, giving me shots, wiping my butt - male nurses, I might add... What about you? You're dressed like a semi-human being... they let you out already?
answer: I'm not getting out. I'm fine.

question: Uh huh. You don't look good.
Delia...
answer: Not bad for video, eh? You're awesome.

question: Castle.
answer: Kable. I've got to thank you for leading me to them, by the by - the human- zuzz that is... But mine's different. Built to send - to transmit . Whereas every other K-soft cell out there - including the ones in... your head, Kable - is designed to receive. I think it, you do it.

question: Very nice, Castle. So you've got an army of psychotics and deviants to dance around for you.
answer: You're thinking small, Kable. But not as small as me.

question: You should've let him fight for himself, Castle - he might've had a shot.
answer: I think you're missing the point, my man.

question: No, I get it - you're pulling the strings on all of this... ... which makes my next move pretty easy to figure.
answer: Neglected to mention Come on, lets boogie woogie rock and roll.

question: Look at this knife... imagine me sticking it into your gut... think about it... make it real.
Damn it, kid...
